intro: Bonamia volkensii, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale blue, with five petals. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
